name: Sailing the Sky (Heather)
description:
Sailing the sky

The concept of “Sailing the Sky” is rooted in the tale of Icarus. It is a story of his attempt to escape from Crete by means of wings that his father, Daedalus, constructed with feathers and wax. Daedalus fashioned two pairs of wings, one for himself and one for his son. Before Daedalus took flight from the island, he warned his son not to fly too close to the sun or the sea, but to follow his path of flight. Overcome by the giddiness that flying lent him, Icarus soared through the sky curiously, but in the process he came too close to the sun, which melted the wax. Icarus kept flapping his wings but soon realized that he had no feathers left and that he was only flapping his bare arms and so Icarus fell into the sea.

Goodfew applies the lessons in the tale of Icarus to how we acquire the solid characteristic of humility.  The plane with the sail underneath is meant to measure and balance out the distance from the water which symbolizes the stabilization of our ego and pride. If ego and pride begins to soar too close to the sun and plummets to the sea, we shall regain traction by the ship landing on its top side; displaying the ability of adaptation. We are as strong as the weakest passenger on our own vessel. The Goodfew is here to support your ambitions and your transformation into the great leader that we believe you to be.  Let us join together and expand on each other’s dreams. 

 “Our era is Elizabethan.  It flourishes with new ideas.  
Compared with the couch potatoes of recent decades, we are all mad scientists.” (Grant McCracken, Culturematic)

name: Building Basics (Navy)
description:
Goodfew Building Basics

Goodfew is rooted by hard work, ambition, and perseverance. These strong characteristics are earned from rising against odds placed in the path of success.

“Building basics” may be open to interpretation but the Goodfew focuses on the vision of expansion on one another’s aspirations through experiences and personal achievements.  Goodfew also envisions the ability to take the knowledge gained from your experiences and utilizing it to make your way into the future.  “Goodfew” is placed above the pyramid in symbolization of our understanding. We understand that the key to success is hard work and humility, and we would like to help others realize it isn’t all about the fame and currency.  Instead, the Goodfew keeps our families close and our goals on a pedestal. The design is not meant to build up the masses; it is aimed at reminding individuals, who have forgotten, of what those “basics” are.

name: Courage Earns Bravery (Heather)
description:
Courage Earns Bravery

“I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.”  -Nelson Mandela

The journey of life takes you on a whirlwind that presents purpose. The design showcases an oversized rain drop hovering over a sailing individual wearing a heavy coat with his fishing pole in hand.   Each element of the design possesses a significant meaning that tells a story of life’s struggle.

Goodfew is represented by an old English letter “G” which indicates the retention of the traditional morals and values that we carry out in our actions.  The oversized raindrop represents the unpredictable, uncontrollable, inevitable events; like Mother Nature, we have no control in how or when these obstacles may occur.  The coat is a representation of self- comfort and warmth in times of loneliness. In today’s society, it is becoming more difficult to reach out for and accept help from those around you without feeling as those you are being looked down upon; and although most of the battles are fought from within, we still are able to express our emotions superficially.  The fishing pole conveys our yearning to search for substance, ideas, and knowledge to aid in our transformation.  The paper boat is a symbol of our vulnerability.  It stands for the duration of hardship that we can endure. Just like a paper, we can fold, crumble, and separate when a cloud of disappointment begins to pour down on our paths.   The waves that run below the boat are separated by three colors: black, blue, and red.  The black layers represent the roughest obstacles. When in trouble, the average individual may result to hiding in their home base, a comfort zone. Departing from this location is the most difficult and crucial step to discovering who you are. At this point in life you are forced to either swim or will be swept away by the toughest current. The blue layer is the journey.  This is the seeking phase, meant to present new opportunities and a network of people/resources.  Lastly, the red represents the journey’s come to a self-realization where the waves are no longer an obstacle but instead a road that will act as the main path to lead us to success.

Courage is the ability to face danger, difficulty, uncertainty, or pain without being overcome by fear. Bravery is the characteristic which we all acquire. Through these times of struggle, we give thanks to those supporting us and hold those who have passed close to our hearts.

name: (Pre-Order) Goodfew Away Baseball Jersey
description:
*Jersey Orders will be shipped out Saturday December 21st, 2013

Home and Away

     Jerseys are appreciated by everyone around the world; some wear them for the love of the team.  Goodfew believes in the unity that a traditional jersey upholds.  Ranging from family and friends, Goodfew looks to expand the feeling of unity across to those who believe in the same perspectives as we do.

    The old English font is chosen for the retention of our traditions that has helped make us who we are today. The three adjacent triangles represent the foundation of Goodfew’s livelihood: ambition, perseverance, and family.  On the posterior, the name, Goodfew, is across the shoulders symbolizing the weight we carry of our “own” belief and perspective in the message Goodfew aims to portray.  The number “Twenty” contains a hidden message which reads “Second to None”.  Goodfew lives by humility, confident but not conceited. Any individual who represents the name should understand that the number “20” communicates the drive to not settle for less than what is deserved. The right sleeve bears the GF insignia reminding us that there is always someone who believes. The Goodfew is family, friends, or an ideal circle of people that has had the privilege of sharing your dreams no matter if you’re home or away.

name: Moment of Peace (Black)
description:
Moment of Peace

“For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.”

Ralph Waldo Emerson

name: Moment of Peace (Maroon)
description:
Moment of Peace

“For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.”

Ralph Waldo Emerson

name: Sand in the City (Royal)
description:
Sand in the City

 “Change the way you look at things and the things you look at change” – Wayne W. Dryer

The concept behind “Sand in the City” is underlined with a meaning that is significant to those who come from a desert terrain area.  The design was intended for individuals who saw their hometown as a trap; a place where growing up had limitations, opportunities looked scarce, and initiative had to be taken. To most, moving out of the desert seemed to always ring a louder bell.   

“Moving out brings freedom but not without loss.” (Goodfew)  There is no place like home no matter where you are in the world.  It is a sanctuary where you can return and rethink your strategy when a minor obstacle sporadically comes about.   Every individual has a certain area in their parents’ home where they, as a child, escaped when the city presented opposing views. Similar to many individuals of the world, we feel that same emotion about our home, the desert. We've come to realize that we are, the Sand that occupies it. 

We move to grow but never forget our roots. We may have started a new beginning in a big city or established a family in quiet suburb, but  we still remain that “Sand in the City.”

name: Heavyweights Tank (Black)
description:
GOODFEW HEAVYWEIGHTS

  When people think of heavyweights they think of the greats such as Muhammad Ali, Mike Tyson, and Rocky Balboa. They accomplished, inspired, and left a legacy behind – similar to our grandparents, Lucio& Susana Coloma. 
 

  The barbells represent the strength we gain from everything we endure and overcome.  The boxers symbolize the constant battle against endless barriers that are set to barricade us from our full potential. 

  The gloves symbolize the willpower, within the Goodfew, to keep pushing when life beats upon our beings. 
  We hold tribute to our grandparents with the numbers 28 & 38. We would not be here today if it wasn’t for their will to see better days.

name: Reformation Tank (Royal)
description:
"You build on failure. You use it as a stepping stone. Close the door on the past. You don't try to forget the mistakes, but you don't dwell on it. You don't let it have any of your energy, or any of your time, or any of your space." -Johnny Cash 

The design is a story, simple and applicable to most of our journeys on how we decide our next big decision when the time came around. 
 
The machete angled downwards signifies the ability to overcome trials and tribulations. We utilize the strengths gained from our experiences to learn to forgive, but most importantly learning to never forget  all that has helped us become who we are today.

The hammer aimed towards the sky symbolizes our ability to rebuild from our past. With a strong foundation based on lessons learned, one can revamp themselves in such a way to construct a whole new empire.  

 The crest along with the name Goodfew above the symbols reminds us that we have family behind us with undying support in everything we choose to do.  Sometimes all we need is a little bit of help, and who better to seek it from than family.

name: Homegrown Jersey (Cardinal)
description:
HOMEGROWN is something that we, The Goodfew, value. No matter what city, country, or planet, HOME is where the heart is. Home  is where you were taught the basics of life, learned right from wrong, met some of your best friends, and  where you don't need a navigation system to get you from point A to point B; home is anything and everything.

The Goodfew FAMILY is a team that moves as a single unit; uplifting one another and always having each other's backs in times of need. We are all on the same court striving for something bigger than ourselves; contributing all we can to make what, some who may have told us, was impossible, possible.

A team jersey was ideal to communicate our message. The number we felt best represented the Goodfew was INFINITY. Not only does the infinity sign signify that goodfew family is forever, it also signifies the infinite capabilities and possibilities that we believe every individual that joins our movement possesses. Never let one person tell you that you cannot do or achieve what you put your mind, heart, and soul into. The GOODFEW will STOP AT NOTHING.
